name: Cigarette Waste Brigade
materials: Cigarette Waste; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: Every year, cigarette butts end up in dumpsters and landfills, or get tossed as litter on shorelines, parks, and sidewalks across the US. With the help of Santa Fe Natural Tobacco Company, a major tobacco manufacturer in the US, the waste collected through the Cigarette Waste Brigade will be recycled into a variety of industrial products, such as plastic pallets, and any remaining tobacco will be re-worked into tobacco composting. Santa Fe Natural Tobacco Company markets their products only to smokers 21 years of age or older. If you or your participants do not smoke, or are under the age of 21, please visit our other Brigade programs to see how you can help the environment. Visit the Cigarette Waste Brigade page for details."

notes: At a time when gold and gem prices are at a historical high, your old jewelry can be converted into both cash payment and bonus TerraCycle points. Whats more, recycling your jewelry can greatly reduce the environmental and social impact on our planet and people. TerraCycle has partnered with SellYourGold.com, an industry leader with a reputation for integrity, to create the Jewelry Brigade. SellYourGold.com will appraise your jewelry within 24 hours of receipt. If you dont accept their offer, they will send back your jewelry in a secure FedEx package at no expense to you. If you do choose to accept their offer, you will receive full payment for your jewelry and an additional 2% of the value will be awarded to you in TerraCycle points. Visit the Jewelry Brigade page for details."

While Malt-O-Meal, Spooners, Three Sisters, Bear River Valley, and Sally's brand cereal bags create 75% less packaging waste than comparably sized cereal boxes, they want to take their commitment to creating less packaging waste one step further by partnering with TerraCycle to create a second life for all cereal bags and cereal bag liners. For each approved cereal bag and cereal bag liner received, your collection location will be awarded two TerraCycle points which can be redeemed for a variety of charitable gifts or for a payment of $0.01 per point to the non-profit organization or school of your choice. Visit the MOM Brands Cereal Bag Brigade page for program details."

name: Nespresso Capsule Brigade
materials: Nespresso Capsules; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: Nespresso has joined with the eco-friendly innovator TerraCycle to provide a second life for used Nespresso capsules through the Nespresso Capsule Brigade. Every time you enjoy Nespresso, save the capsule and recycle it with TerraCycle. TerraCycle will collect all consumer Nespresso capsules and then recycle them into two streams. The metal capsules will be melted down and turned into new aluminum products. Residual coffee will be separated and sent to an industrial composting facility. Visit the Nespresso Capsule Brigade page for program details."

name: Packing Multi-Stream Brigade
materials: Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: The Packaging Multi-Stream Brigade allows you to collect a range of waste streams without having to separate the waste (as with TerraCycle's traditional collection programs). There are no signup or participation fees, and the shipping is free. Please note: Waste received through the Packaging Multi-Stream Brigade is worth half of the donation from the standard TerraCycle Brigade. For example, each lunch kit you send to TerraCycle via the Packaging Multi-Stream Brigade is worth 1 point instead of 2. Visit the Packing Multi-Stream Brigade page for program details."

materials: Shoes; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: The Paired Shoe Brigade is a simple and effective way to repurpose your old shoes while earning rewards for your organization or the charity of your choice. Instead of throwing your old shoes away, be a Goody Two-Shoes and send them in to give them a second life. Each pair of shoes is diverted from landfills. All acceptable paired shoes are re-purposed and resold as-is, which provides the lowest carbon footprint when considering solutions for your used footwear. With help from our partner, all of the usable sneakers and shoes are exported to developing countries where there is tremendous demand for affordable and sought-after footwear. Visit the Paired Shoe Brigade page for program details."

name: Personal Care and Beauty Brigade
materials: Personal Care Packaging; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: Each year millions of personal care products and beauty product packages are needlessly discarded and end up in landfills. TerraCycle is proud to partner with Garnier to create a second life for these empty containers. Every time you finish your personal care or beauty product we want you to save the packaging and send it in so we can recycle the material into fun and innovative products. For each approved item received, your collection location will be awarded two TerraCycle points which can be redeemed for a variety of charitable gifts or for a payment of $0.01 per point to the non-profit organization or school of your choice. Visit the Personal Care and Beauty Brigade for program details."

name: Scotch Tape Brigade
materials: Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: Millions of tape dispensers and cores needlessly end up in landfills across the country. Thats why Scotch Tape has partnered with TerraCycle to keep used tape dispensers out of landfills. Through this innovative program, people will be able to collect used plastic tape dispensers and cores and earn TerraCycle points for them! For each approved tape dispenser and core received, your collection location will be awarded two TerraCycle points, which can be redeemed for a variety of charitable gifts or for a payment of $0.01 per point to the non-profit organization or school of your choice. Visit the Scotch Tape Brigade page for program details."

name: Snack Bag Brigade
materials: Snack Bags; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: Frito-Lay, Terra Chips, and Sensible Portions share a common vision of being environmentally responsible while providing quality products for families to enjoy. That is why these brands have joined TerraCycle to provide a second life for empty salty snack bags. Now, every time you enjoy any snack, be sure to save the bag and send it in to TerraCycle to be converted into unique products. For each approved salty snack bag received, your collection location may be awarded TerraCycle points which can be redeemed for a variety of charitable gifts or for a payment of $0.01 per point to the non-profit organization or school of your choice. Visit the Snack Bag Brigade page for program details."

name: Solo Cup Brigade
materials: #6 Plastic Cups; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: Each year Solo Squared cups are needlessly discarded and end up in landfills.TerraCycle is proud to partner with the Solo Cup Company to create a second life for these used cups. The TerraCycle Solo Cup Brigade program allows all individuals and organizations to provide a second life for used cups by sending them in to TerraCycle. For each approved cup received
groups: you will be awarded two TerraCycle points which can be redeemed for a variety of charity gifts or a payment of $0.01 per point to Keep America Beautiful
curbside: or the non-profit organization of your choice."

name: The Naked Grape Wine Box Brigade
description: The Naked Grape Wine Box Brigade
materials: Naked Grape Packaging; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: TerraCycle is committed to keeping used wine boxes out of landfills by recycling them into new unique products. Thanks to the generous support of The Naked Grape, for each approved The Naked Grape brand wine box, pouch and spout received, $0.02 will be donated to Clothes4Souls*. Visit the The Naked Grape Wine Box Brigade page for program details."

name: Toms of Maine Natural Care Brigade
description: Toms of Maine Natural Care Brigade
materials: Personal Care Packaging; Tooth Care Packaging; Toothbrushes; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: Each and every year, the products we use everyday to make our bodies clean, our teeth bright and shiny, and keep us smelling fresh, end up being thrown away after use and ultimately end up in a landfill. Toms of Maine, a leader in natural oral and personal care products, and pioneer in environmental stewardship since 1970, has partnered with eco-innovator TerraCycle to provide a second life for empty and used toothpaste tubes, toothbrushes, floss containers, mouthwash bottles, soap packaging, and antiperspirant and deodorant containers. Together we can convert these would-be waste materials into fun and unique products! For each approved item received, your collection location will be awarded two TerraCycle points which can be redeemed for a variety of charity gifts or for a payment of $0.01 per point to the school or non-profit organization of your choice. Visit the Toms of Maine Natural Care Brigade page for program details."

name: Writing Instruments Brigade
materials: Writing Instruments; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: Pens, pen caps, mechanical pencils, markers and marker caps accepted. Visit the Writing Instruments Brigade page to learn more."
